snippet: With studies suggesting that long lines at the polls cost Democrats hundreds of thousands of votes in November, party leaders are beginning a push to make voting and voter registration easier.
abstract: Democratic party leaders are beginning push to make voting and voter registration easier, setting up likely new conflict with Republicans over deeply polarizing issue; Democrats in House and Senate have already introduced bills that would require states to provide online voter registration and allow at least 15 days of early voting; recent studies suggest that long waiting lines in some places depressed voter turnout in 2012.

byline.contributor: Neil Reisner contributed reporting from North Miami, Fla.

lead_paragraph: With studies suggesting that long lines at the polls cost Democrats hundreds of thousands of votes in November, party leaders are beginning a push to make voting and voter registration easier.

headline.seo: Voter Waiting Time Disparities Draw Democrats’ Scrutiny
headline.main: Waiting Times at Ballot Boxes Draw Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Waiting Times At Ballot Boxes Draw Scrutiny
